text:
Use_equals=true seems to be the default behaviour of 1.8.1 and now if a 1.8.1
script is read into 1.9.1 and if the variable does not have a value it sets it
to false.

If you save a 1.8.1 script in 1.9.1 it will only save use_equals if it is true.
 This means you couldn't just save it in 1.9.1 and change all use.equals=false
to true.

When you record a new script in 1.9.1 it sets all use_equals true, no mater if
there is a value or not.
creator: chrispesarchick@westfieldgrp.com

text:
Please correct me if I'm wrong, but:
* This is a backward compatibility bug.
* It has been there for so long, that probably everyone has already done
whatever was necessary to migrate.

So it's most likely not relevant anymore. I mean that resolving this in 1.9.2 or
whatever is out next will probably not help anyone much.

If it is relevant for you, please reopen the bug and start a discussion on
whether it should be fixed in jmeter-dev -- there may be people for whom
resolving this causes the same kind of backward compatibility issues when
migrating from 1.9.1 to whatever is next. We should reach consensus on how to
deal with this.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
